data.value: Collaboration
Slide to the left or right to select a sentence describing your most likely behaviour.
Define the collaboration principles and governance
I miss the opportunity to clarify with the team the ways of working and/or let conflicts disable the collaboration.
I meet with the team before starting the execution of projects/tasks to help them and define how they will work together. I set the principles of collaboration.
I engage team members around a common purpose and a clear governance. I anticipate potential areas of tension and define the process to overcome them when they arise.
I do not know.
Foster a culture where collective intelligence takes precedence over individual ones
I value individual approaches and opportunistic decisions that drive immediate results to the detriment of a collective long-lasting success.
I praise collective success. I encourage people to place their own interest after collective interest (team, Maison).
I foster a culture that promotes collective intelligence and anticipate how collaboration enables the company's overall impact on its ecosystem.
I do not know.
Remove barries to collaboration
I procrastinate conflict management, missing the opportunity to remove the barriers to collaboration, and/or let organisational conflicts become people conflicts.
When facing collaboration obstacles, I focus the team on what can be done differently in the future rather than speaking about the past.
I anticipate and remove the systemic barriers to collaboration (example: silos across departments and teams).
I do not know
Foster a feedback culture
I miss the opportunity to redirect people's complaints/gossip to the right incumbent and/or allow triangulation and/or procrastinate feedback.
I invite people to deliver sincere, selective and specific feedback.
I foster a culture where feedback is a foundation to develop an environment of respect and truth.
I do not know.
Promote diversity and its value
I might judge others and/or place them in a ‘box’ and/or allow stereotyping and/or discriminative statements to take over in conversations.
I promote diversity of points of view and personalities. I work to reduce the gap between perception and reality, intention and reputation.

I foster a culture of diversity. I welcome and integrate people with different perspectives. I am able to challenge one's own point of view (example: people who tell you what you need to hear, not what you want to hear).
I do not know.
